title: Check a public building has an energy performance certificate

details.description: Energy Performance Certificate - Display Energy Certificate (DEC), what the certificate shows, where to find the certificate
details.body:
Find out about a public building’s energy use and carbon emissions by checking the Display Energy Certificate (DEC).

What a Display Energy Certificate will tell you

Display Energy Certificates (DECs) are designed to show the energy performance of public buildings.

They use a scale that runs from ‘A’ to ‘G’ - ‘A’ being the most efficient and ‘G’ being the least. DECs are updated every year.

Download an example DEC (PDF, 253KB)

Buildings that need a certificate

A building must have a DEC if it:

  • is occupied by public authorities, eg local government, school, prisons
  • is an institution providing a public services to a large number of people, eg a library
  • has a floor area of over 1,000 metres squared
  • is frequently visited by the public

Where to find the certificate

A DEC should be on display in a prominent place clearly visible to the public, eg near the entrance to the building. If an organisation doesn’t do this they can be fined £500.

If you can’t find the DEC you should contact the occupier of the building. If this fails, you can contact your local Trading Standards office.
